channel.title: What I'm Not by Nature, I Am by Grace
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons License - Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike - http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/
channel.description:
Being adopted by God in Christ is part of the Salvation experience for every believer.
Sadly, many are afraid of spiritual intimacy, unsure of their security in Christ, and awkward with the idea of a Heavenly Father who loves so extravagantly and personally. This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com

image.title: What I'm Not by Nature, I Am by Grace

channel.itunes:author: Mary Diane Goin
channel.itunes:subtitle: What I'm Not by Nature, I Am by Grace
channel.itunes:summary:
Being adopted by God in Christ is part of the Salvation experience for every believer.
Sadly, many are afraid of spiritual intimacy, unsure of their security in Christ, and awkward with the idea of a Heavenly Father who loves so extravagantly and personally. This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com
channel.itunes:keywords: adoption in Christ, Father God, spiritual intimacy, baptism, Salvation, Justification, Sanctification

item.title: Taking Up My Cross: What It Is, What It's Not
item.author: goinwell@nc.rr.com
item.description: We've all heard, "Well, it's just my cross to bear." Yet for the Christian, what is authentic cross-bearing? Equally important, what does not qualify as a real cross?
item.itunes:author: Mary Diane Goin
item.itunes:subtitle: Taking Up My Cross: What It Is, What It's Not
item.itunes:summary: We've all heard, "Well, it's just my cross to bear." Yet for the Christian, what is authentic cross-bearing? Equally important, what does not qualify as a real cross?
item.itunes:keywords: adoption in Christ, Father God, spiritual intimacy, baptism, Salvation, Justification, Sanctification

item.title: What I'm Not by Nature, I Am by Grace
item.author: goinwell@nc.rr.com
item.description: Being adopted by God in Christ gives us a new name, identity, and a secure, loving home. Understanding this important relational aspect of Salvation helps the believer truly enjoy Father God and his spiritual family.
item.itunes:author: Mary Diane Goin
item.itunes:subtitle: What I'm Not by Nature, I Am by Grace
item.itunes:summary: Being adopted by God in Christ gives us a new name, identity, and a secure, loving home. Understanding this important relational aspect of Salvation helps the believer truly enjoy Father God and his spiritual family.
item.itunes:keywords: adoption in Christ, Father God, spiritual intimacy, baptism, Salvation, Justification, Sanctification
